------------------------------------------------------------------------
Ben Nghe Street food Market is a place to welcome many Western tourists and other Vietnamese at home and abroad.  Inside are the familiar dishes of the West and Ta such as Turkish food, Mexican food, Indian food.  And more specifically, Ben Nghe Street Food Market has specialties of 3 regions of the country, which are Banh Xeo, Bun Bo Hue, Goi Cuon, Quang noodles, Cao Lau Hoi An, and other specialties for tourists to open their eyes and help other provinces experience many dishes in all parts of the country and moreover, help a part of the Western world to experience their own dishes.  The price is also affordable for tourists to experience.
Ben Nghe Street Food Market thank you so much

title: Donâ€™t go here / Ä‘á»«ng Ä‘áº¿n Ä‘Ã¢y
text:
Donâ€™t let the decor fool you. I had a horrible experience here! We were rushed and experience discrimination. Right when we sat down, we didnâ€™t even have time to look at the menu and weâ€™re rushed with our order. We politely asked to have more time and the server stood by us and kept prying us. After we ordered we the food was rushed to us before we even had plates to eat. Why rush us to order if you wonâ€™t provide us dishes to eat with? The bathroom experience was horrible and the sanitary/attendant just stared at us. It was so uncomfortable. 

Iâ€™m Vietnamese American. Born and raised in the states but can speak Vietnamese. The people at the restaurant treat foreigners much better than Vietnamese people. Iâ€™ve traveled all over vietnam, donâ€™t let the rude people fool you, this is not normal in vietnam. 

Food was completely mid. Average at best. For its price in vietnam, you can have much better food and support vendors that are kind/genuine. Skip this if you can! If I could Iâ€™d give it 0 stars.

title: Should try when in Hanoi
text:
Didnâ€™t visit the restaurant on purpose but it turned out that the overall experience was good in terms of the service and some selected food. 
My friend wanted to try Vietnamese food so we went there and order signature Vietnamese dishes from all 3 parts of Vietnam. Summer rolls and Nem Lui was yummy! But Cha Ca was not.. as it was a bit tasteless and Nha Trang beef was salty though smelled soo good. In general, the quality was average though reflected Vietnamese cuisines very well. 

The restaurant was easy to locate and the staff was friendly. A minus point was that it was overcrowded and people are required to wait for like 20 minutes if they donâ€™t reserve a table in advance.

text:
Donâ€™t let the decor fool you. I had a horrible experience here! We were rushed and experience discrimination. Right when we sat down, we didnâ€™t even have time to look at the menu and weâ€™re rushed with our order. We politely asked to have more time and the server stood by us and kept prying us. After we ordered we the food was rushed to us before we even had plates to eat. Why rush us to order if you wonâ€™t provide us dishes to eat with? The bathroom experience was horrible and the sanitary/attendant just stared at us. It was so uncomfortable. 

Iâ€™m Vietnamese American. Born and raised in the states but can speak Vietnamese. The people at the restaurant treat foreigners much better than Vietnamese people. Iâ€™ve traveled all over vietnam, donâ€™t let the rude people fool you, this is not normal in vietnam. 

Food was completely mid. Average at best. For its price in vietnam, you can have much better food and support vendors that are kind/genuine. Skip this if you can! If I could Iâ€™d give it 0 stars.

Hoai River Night - Pho Hoi
River Hoai is a branch of Thu Bon River that flows in the middle of the Old Town, is a forever remembering river of Quang people who have traveled far away. The river is beautifully sparkling and fanciful every night when it comes to the festival with a flower lights drop and reflecting the colorful light down from both sides of the river, creating a feeling of calm and romance in a quiet space. Almost in stark contrast to the crowded, crowded night market, shops on both sides of the river

title: Should try when in Hanoi
text:
Didnâ€™t visit the restaurant on purpose but it turned out that the overall experience was good in terms of the service and some selected food. 
My friend wanted to try Vietnamese food so we went there and order signature Vietnamese dishes from all 3 parts of Vietnam. Summer rolls and Nem Lui was yummy! But Cha Ca was not.. as it was a bit tasteless and Nha Trang beef was salty though smelled soo good. In general, the quality was average though reflected Vietnamese cuisines very well. 

The restaurant was easy to locate and the staff was friendly. A minus point was that it was overcrowded and people are required to wait for like 20 minutes if they donâ€™t reserve a table in advance.
